member.name: T:Rock.Extension.Component
member.summary:
Abstract class that custom component classes should derive from.
The derived class should define the following type attributes
[Description("description of component")] [Export( typeof( Component ) )] [ExportMetadata( "ComponentName", "Name of Component" )]
The derived class can also optionally define one or more property type attributes
[Rock.Attribute.Property( 1, "License Key", "The Required License Key" )]
To get the value of a property, the derived class can use the AttributeValues property
string licenseKey = AttributeValues["LicenseKey"].Value;

member.name: P:Rock.Data.Entity`1.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the identifier. This value is the primary field/key for the entity object. This value is system and database dependent, and is not guaranteed to be unique. This id should only be used to identify an object internally to a single implementation of RockChMS since this value has a very high probability of not being consistent in an external implementation of RockChMS.
member.value: Primary and system dependent based identity/key of an entity object in RockChMS.

member.name: P:Rock.Data.Entity`1.Guid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that is a guaranteed unique identifier for the entity object. This value is an alternate key for the object, and should be used when interacting with external systems and when comparing and synchronizing objects across across data stores or external /implementations of RockChMS
member.remarks: A good place for a Guid to be used is when comparing or syncing data across two implementations of RockChMS. For example, if you were creating a with a data migration that adds/remove a new defined value object to the database. You would want to search based on the Guid because it would be guaranteed to be unique across all implementations of RockChMS.
member.value: A value that will uniquely identify the entity/object across all implementations of RockChMS.

member.name: P:Rock.Data.Entity`1.TypeId
member.summary: Gets the Id for the Entity object type in RockChMS. If an is not found for the object type it will be created
member.value: An that represents the identifier for the current Entity object type.

member.value: The name of the entity type.

member.value: An encrypted that represents the entity object.

member.name: P:Rock.Web.UI.RockBlock.BreadCrumbs
member.summary: Gets the bread crumbs that were created during the page's oninit. A block can add additional breadcrumbs to this list to be rendered. Crumb's added this way will not be saved to the current page reference's collection of breadcrumbs, so wil not be available when user navigates to another child page. Because of this only last-level crumbs should be added this way. To persist breadcrumbs in the session state, override the GetBreadCrumbs method instead.

member.name: T:Rock.Reporting.DataFilter.PropertyFilter.EntityField
member.summary:
Helper class for saving information about each property and attribute of an entity Note: the type of a field or attribute does not neccesarily determine the ui rendered for filtering. For example, a Single-Select attribute will use a multi-select ui so that user can filter on one or more values. The FilterFieldType property determines the UI rendered for filtering and not the type of field.
Entity Property Types and their renderd filter field type string -> TEXT bool or bool? -> SINGLE_SELECT date or date? -> DATE int or int? Defined Values -> MULTI_SELECT otherwise -> INTEGER enumeration -> MULTI_SELECT
Attribute types and their rendered filter field type MULTI_SELECT -> MULTI_SELECT SINGLE_SELECT -> MULTI_SELECT BOOLEAN -> SINGLE_SELECT (True or False) DATE -> DATE INTEGER -> INTEGER TEXT -> TEXT

member.name: M:Rock.Reporting.DataFilter.OtherDataViewFilter.GetClientFormatSelection(System.Type)
member.summary: Formats the selection on the client-side. When the filter is collapsed by the user, the Filterfield control will set the description of the filter to whatever is returned by this property. If including script, the controls parent container can be referenced through a '$content' variable that is set by the control before referencing this property.

member.summary: Gets or sets where print jobs for this device originates from.
member.value: A to indicate how print jobs should be handled from this device. If PrintFrom.Client the print job will be handled from the client, otherwise PrintFrom.Server and the print job will be handled from the server.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.Device.PrintToOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that overrides which printer the print job is set to.
member.value: A that indicates overrides where the print job is set to. If PrintTo.Default the print job will be sent to the default printer, if PrintTo.Kiosk the print job will be sent to the printer associated with the kiosk, if PrintTo.Location the print job will be sent to the printer at the check in location.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.Device.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical location or geographic fence for the device.
member.value: A entity that represents the physical location of or the geographic fence for the device.
member.remarks: A physical location would signify where the device is at. A situation where a geographic fence could be used would be for mobile check in, where if the device is within the fence, a user would be able to check in from their mobile device.

member.name: T:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker
member.summary:
This control will create a Google map with drawring tools that allows the user to define a single point or a polygon which forms a geo-fence depending on the .
To use on a page or usercontrol:
<Rock:GeoPicker ID="gpGeoPoint" runat="server" Required="false" Label="Geo Point" DrawingMode="Point" />
To set an initial value:
gpGeoPoint.SetValue( DbGeography.FromText("POINT(-122.335197 47.646711)") );
To access the value after it's been set use the property:
DbGeography point = gpGeoPoint.SelectedValue;
If you wish to set an appropriate, initial center point you can use the property.

member.name: M:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker.ConvertPointToWellKnownText(System.String)
member.summary: Converts single coordinate set (lat,long) into the Well Known Text (WKT) POINT format. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text

member.name: M:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker.ConvertPolyToWellKnownText(System.String)
member.summary: Convert string from "lat1,long1|lat2,long2|..." to Well Known Text (WKT) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Well-known_text format "POLYGON(( long1 lat1, long2 lat2, ...))". It is expected that the input is a single polygon (not a polygon with an inner polygon). It will also correct the orientation (clockwise-ness) of the points because DbGeography needs them to be in counter-clockwise order.
member.returns: A Well Known Text (WKT) POLYGON string suitable for use by DbGeography

member.name: M:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker.ConvertPointFromWellKnownText(System.String)
member.summary: Convert from WKT format: "POINT (long1 lat1)" to "lat1,long1"
member.param: a POINT in Well Known Text format

member.name: M:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker.ConvertPolyFromWellKnownText(System.String)
member.summary: Convert from WKT format: "POLYGON ((long1 lat1, long2 lat2, ...))" to "lat1,long1|lat2,long2|..."
member.param: a POLYGON in Well Known Text format
member.returns: string suitable for Google Maps polygon geoPicker "lat1,long1|lat2,long2|..."

member.name: M:Rock.Web.UI.Controls.GeoPicker.IsClockwisePolygon(System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Attempt to determine if the polygon is clockwise or counter-clockwise. Thank you dominoc! http://dominoc925.blogspot.com/2012/03/c-code-to-determine-if-polygon-vertices.html

member.name: T:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog
member.summary: Represents an entry in the Exception Log. It is a record of an exception that was was thrown and logged by the RockChMS system/framework. These exceptions can include several status codes, the one most often seen is 500, but can also include 404 (when configured in Global Attributes) and other status codes. These entities are not tracked by the model.

member.returns: A containing the Exception's description that represents this instance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the parent/outer ExceptionLog entity (if it exists). ExceptionLog entities are hierarchical.
member.value: An representing the Id of the parent ExceptionId. If this ExceptionLog entity does not have a parent exception, will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.SiteId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the that the exception occurred on. If this did not occur on a site (i.e. a job) this value will be null.
member.value: A representing the Id of that this exception occurred on.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.Site
member.summary: Gets or sets the that the exception occurred on.
member.value: The that the exception occurred on. If this did not occur on a site, this value will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.PageId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the that the exception occurred on.
member.value: A representing the Id of the that the exception occurred on. If this exception did not occur on a this value will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.Page
member.summary: Gets or sets the that the exception occurred on.
member.value: The that the exception occurred on. If this exception was not thrown on a this value will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.ExceptionDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time stamp of when the exception occurred. This property is required.
member.value: A representing the time-stamp of when the exception occurred.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.CreatedByPersonId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Id of the who created the exception. This is usually the Id of the person who was logged in when the exception occurred.
member.value: A representing the Id of the that created the exception. If it was created by the anonymous user or when it was created by a process, this value will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.CreatedByPerson
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity of the person who created the exception.
member.value: The who created the exception. If the exception was created by the anonymous user or by a process this value will be null

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.HasInnerException
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if this exception has a child/inner exception.
member.value: A value that will be true if the exception has an inner exception otherwise false or null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the StatusCode that was returned and describes the type of error.
member.value: A value representing the StatusCode that was returned as part of this exception. If a StatusCode was returned this value will be null.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.ExceptionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type (exception class) of the exception that occurred. i.e. System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException
member.value: A representing the type name of the exception that occurred.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a message that describes the exception.
member.value: A representing the description of the exception.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application or the object that causes the error.
member.value: A representing the class type name/application that threw the exception.

member.summary: Gets a string representation of the immediate frames on the call stack.
member.value: A representing the StackTrace of the exception that occurred.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.ExceptionLog.PageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative URL of the page that the exception occurred on.
member.value: A representing the URL of the that the exception occurred on.

member.name: T:Rock.Model.PersonMerged
member.summary:
Represents the merge history for people in RockChMS. When a person is found to have a duplicate entity in the database the duplicate entities need to be merged together into one record to avoid confusion and to ensure that we have accurate contact, involvement, and contribution data. It also helps to avoid situations where an individual is counted or contacted multiple times.
The PersonMerged entity is a log containing the merge history (previous Person identifiers) and a pointer to the Person's current Id.

member.summary: Creates a raw SQL query that will return elements of the given type. The type can be any type that has properties that match the names of the columns returned from the query, or can be a simple primitive type. The type does not have to be an entity type. The results of this query are never tracked by the context even if the type of object returned is an entity type. Use the SqlQuery(System.String,System.Object[]) method to return entities that are tracked by the context.

member.name: T:Rock.Model.Block
member.summary:
Represents an implementation of a in RockChMS. A block can be implemented on a Site's and appear on all pages on the site that uses that template or on an individual .
An example of a Block being implemented on a layout template would be an implementation of a HTML Content Block Type in the footer zone of a layout that contains the site's copyright notice. This Block will show on all Pages of the that uses the layout.
An example of a Block being implemented on a page would be the New Account being implemented on the New Account page.

member.name: T:Rock.Model.Page
member.summary:
Represents an individual webpage in RockChMS. A page is a container on a that has a which consists of one or more content area zones. Each content area zone on the page can contain zero or more Blocks..
Pages are hierarchical, and are used to create the structure of the site. Each page can have one parent Page and zero or more children pages, and the page hierarchy is used to create the SiteMap.

member.name: T:Rock.Model.PageRoute
member.summary: Represents a PageRoute object in RockChMS. All pages in RockChMS are accessed via a PageRoute. The default route that is used in RockChMS is /page/{pageId} (for example /page/113 tells Rock to load the associated with PageId 113). This model allows for custom page routes to be created, which in turn allows us to use Friendlier Urls (for example the default New Account page can be accessed by /NewAccount as well as /page/4).

member.value: A containing the format of the RoutePath.

member.name: T:Rock.Model.Location
member.summary: Location Entity class. A location in Rock is any physical place. It could be a street address, building, floor, room, kiosk location, etc. A location is also stackable/hierarchical. For example for a church's campus can have multiple buildings or facilities, each building can be multi story and a story can have multiple rooms.

member.param: A representing the latitude for this location.
A representing the longitude for this location.

member.returns: A containing the link to Google Maps for this location.

member.remarks: Examples of this could be a radius around a church campus to allow mobile check in if a person is located within a certain radius of the campus, or it could be used to define the parameter of an area (i.e. neighborhood, park, etc.)
member.value: A object representing the parameter of a location.

member.name: P:Rock.Model.Location.IsNamedLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is a named location.
member.value: A that is true if this instance is a named location; otherwise, false.

member.value: A representing the second line of the Location's Street/Mailing Address. if this Location does not have Street/Mailing Address or if the address does not have a 2nd line, this value is null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the city component of the Location's Street/Mailing Address.

member.value: A representing the state component of the Location's Street/Mailing Address. If this Location does not have a Street/Mailing Address, this value will be null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the country component of the Location's Street/Mailing Address.
member.value: A representing the country component of the Location's Street/Mailing Address. If this Location does not have a Street/Mailing Address, this value will be null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the component name of the Geocoding service that attempted the most recent address Geocode attempt.
member.value: A representing the component name of the Geocoding service that attempted the most recent address Geocode attempt. If geocoding has not been attempted for this location, the value will be null.

member.value: A representing the date and time that the address of this location was successfully geocoded. If geocoding has not been attepted for this location or the location had not been successfully geocoded this value will be null.

member.name: M:Rock.Data.EFRepository.ExecuteQuery(System.Type,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a raw SQL query that will return elements of the given type. The type can be any type that has properties that match the names of the columns returned from the query, or can be a simple primitive type. The type does not have to be an entity type. The results of this query are never tracked by the context even if the type of object returned is an entity type. Use the SqlQuery(System.String,System.Object[]) method to return entities that are tracked by the context.
